head.title: Becht Is the First To Strike a Deal

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/Sports/Pro Football/National Football League/New York Jets

hedline.hl1: Becht Is the First To Strike a Deal

abstract.p: New York Jets sign draft-pick Anthony Becht (S)

block.p: The Jets wasted little time in tackling the unprecedented task of signing their four first-round draft picks, signing tight end Anthony Becht yesterday. Becht was the first of the Jets' four first-rounders and only the second first-round selection -- after the first overall pick, Courtney Brown, of Cleveland -- to reach a deal. Becht, from West Virginia, was the Jets' fourth first-round pick and the 27th player selected over all. Becht's deal is for five years and, according to his agent, is front-loaded with signing, workout and roster cash bonuses with guaranteed money later, which fulfills two needs: to give Becht cash now, and to help the Jets' dire salary cap circumstances.

The Jets wasted little time in tackling the unprecedented task of signing their four first-round draft picks, signing tight end Anthony Becht yesterday. Becht was the first of the Jets' four first-rounders and only the second first-round selection -- after the first overall pick, Courtney Brown, of Cleveland -- to reach a deal. Becht, from West Virginia, was the Jets' fourth first-round pick and the 27th player selected over all. Becht's deal is for five years and, according to his agent, is front-loaded with signing, workout and roster cash bonuses with guaranteed money later, which fulfills two needs: to give Becht cash now, and to help the Jets' dire salary cap circumstances.
The remaining unsigned first rounders are defensive lineman Shaun Ellis, linebacker John Abraham and quarterback Chad Pennington.
